etymologies: late 16th century (in an earlier sense). From classical Latin recrēmentum refuse, waste, dross (from re- + cernere + -mentum)

definitions: The superfluous or useless portion of a substance; refuse, dross, scum.
A superfluous or useless fragment, a remnant, a piece of rubbish; leftover or discarded material, rubbish, dregs.
